Articles.Content: Just an annoying thing I'm noticing. The default UI is WAAAAAY too big, in my opinion. If I scale it down via the setting menu, it makes everything else really tiny and hard to read (and the navball and other parts of the UI are still the same size). I suggest making the UI scale option not affect text. Is anyone else experiencing this? Do you know of a way to make the navball smaller without shrinking the text?

NOTE: this mod is no longer needed from KSP version 1.1.1 on - the in-game settings have a slider to resize the navball (among other UI elements).

Edited May 11, 2016 by swjr-swis
mod became stock in 1.1.1
Oh my goodness, thank you very much for showing me this! Now I can actually play 1.1 without my picky brain making me angry (LOL)!

I had the same issue on this one. I solved it by going into the settings.cfg and changing the setting for UI Scaling to .8 instead of 1. it works for me because I am using full screen due to a workaround for bug #7493.

I tried scaling down the UI (also because of the navball being way too big) but noticed that it produced another problem: the Apoapsis and Periapsis markers on the map view appear INSIDE the planet instead of on the orbital trajectory where they should be! I set the UI back to 100% and the markers returned to their proper locations. Has anyone else noticed this? It seems to make non-100%-UI settings useless.
Yup... UI scale scales everything and its worse than half of the screen nav ball and portraits... I dont get how devs can make this kind of an oversight....

My problem with Navball is that velocity indicator attached to top of it as well as heading indicator attached to bottom, obscure parts of navball, hiding navigation markers under them.

Navball should be fully visible, no other indicators snapped on top of it!
